sections.text:
28-311.03.Stalking.

Any person who willfully harasses another person or a family or household member of such person with the intent to injure, terrify, threaten, or intimidate commits the offense of stalking.

SourceLaws 1992, LB 1098, ยง 2;Laws 1993, LB 299, ยง 2;Laws 1998, LB 218, ยง 4;Laws 2006, LB 1113, ยง 22.

Annotations

Nebraska's stalking statutes focus both on the behavior of the perpetrator and on the experience of the victim. In re Interest of Jeffrey K., 273 Neb. 239, 728 N.W.2d 606 (2007).
